alert.note: Alert for Boulder And Jefferson Counties Below 6000 Feet, West Broomfield County; Central and East Adams and Arapahoe Counties; Central and South Weld County; Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; Larimer County Below 6000 Feet, Northwest Weld County; Morgan County; North Douglas County Below 6000 Feet, Denver, West Adams and Arapahoe Counties, East Broomfield County; North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County; Northeast Weld County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 31 at 10:10PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...The Front Range I-25 Urban Corridor and adjacent plains through Weld, Morgan, eastern Adams, eastern Arapahoe, and northern Lincoln Counties. * WHEN...Until Midnight MDT tonight. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Storms with heavy rain are spreading east into Morgan, eastern Adams, eastern Arapahoe, and northern Lincoln Counties. They will be capable of producing 1 to 2 inches of rain in less than an hour. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Front Range I-25 Corridor, Palmer Divide, and northeast plains of Colorado. * WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon through Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Thunderstorms are expected to develop in the afternoon and evening hours. Storms will be capable of producing 1 to 2 inches of rain in 45 minutes or less.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
